result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C Miller

records.addlTxt: Submitted by the State.  Forwarded to B3 jdash.
Personal service notice dated 10-31-2022 was not provided to Attorney Frederick F Klimetz as attorney is required to opt in under Wis. Stats. 801.18(3)(a)1 and 801.18(5)(e).

10:06 AM Defendant Christopher C Miller appeared by video, in custody of OZSD. Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Christopher C Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel was just appointed. Time limits waived. Court officer advises defendant will be moved to DCI before next hearing date.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

8:34 AM Defendant Christopher C Miller appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant that a public defender has not yet been appointed.  Defendant to continue contacting PD's office. Court finds good cause to extend any time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:23 AM Defendant Christopher C Miller appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant contacted and spoke with public defender's office by phone but  no attorney ever came to speak with him. Court record indicates defendant does qualify. Court finds good cause to extend any time limits while public defender finds an appointment.
Status hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
No contact with: K.C.S.  Defendant not to possess any dangerous weapons or firearms.

1:49 PM Defendant Christopher C Miller appeared by video, in custody at the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Christopher C Miller.  Attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $50,000 cash bail with conditions. Counsel provided with complaint in court. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Counsel advises Defendant currently on probation hold. Counsel requesting to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
